fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.examples.molene.wbsm

Class WiFiBandwidthSensorModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.Model
      • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.AtomicModel
        • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.hioa.models.AtomicHIOA
          • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.hioa.models.AtomicHIOAwithEquations
            • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.examples.molene.wbsm.WiFiBandwidthSensorModel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MoleneModelImplementationI, EventsExchangingI, ModelDescriptionI, VariablesSharingI, AtomicModelI, ModelI, java.io.Serializable

    public class WiFiBandwidthSensorModel
extends AtomicHIOAwithEquations
implements MoleneModelImplementationI
    The class WiFiBandwidthSensorModel implements a sensor model as an HIOA that imports a variable giving the current bandwidth of the network and exporting events that contains the value of the current bandwidth.

    Description

    The model shares with the WiFiBandwidthModel the continuous variable bandwidth produced by the latter. It also imports the event TicEvent from the TicModel. Each time the model receives a tic event, it emits an exported event WiFiBandwidthReading containing the latest value of the bandwidth.

    Because in the DEVS protocol, the processing of an external event cannot trigger the issuing of an external event, the above behaviour is implemented through three steps:

    1. an external tic event is received and processed by toggling the boolean variable triggerReading at true;
    2. when the triggerReading is true, the method timeAdvance returns a 0 time delay until the next internal transition;
    3. the triggered internal transition first requires a call to the method output, which emits the battery level event;
    4. the internal transition is then executed and toggles triggerReading back to false.

    And then the process can iterate again until the end of the simulation.

    After the runs, the report returned by this model provides a piecewise constant double function giving the readings of the WiFi bandwidth over the whole simulation duration.

    Invariant

     invariant              true

    Created on : 2018-07-17

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

                                java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit simulatedTimeUnit,
                                SimulatorI simulationEngine)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        create an instance of the WiFi bandwidth sensor model.

        Contract

         pre     simulatedTimeUnit != null
 pre     simulationEngine == null || simulationEngine instanceof HIOA_AtomicEngine
 post    getURI() != null
 post    uri != null implies getURI().equals(uri)
 post    getSimulatedTimeUnit().equals(simulatedTimeUnit)
 post    simulationEngine != null implies getSimulationEngine().equals(simulationEngine)
        Parameters:
        uri - unique identifier of the model.
        simulatedTimeUnit - time unit used for the simulation clock.
        simulationEngine - simulation engine enacting the model.

      • output

        public java.util.ArrayList<EventI> output()
        Description copied from interface: AtomicModelI
        maps the current internal state to the output set; this method is user-model-dependent hence must be implemented by the user for atomic models.

        Description

        Beware that when this method is called, though the simulation time has conceptually reached the time if the next internal event, the value returned by getCurrentStateTime has not yet been update to that time. Hence the actual current simulation time is given by this.getCurrentStateTime().add(this.getNextTimeAdvance()).

        Contract

         pre     isInitialised()
 pre     getNextTimeAdvance().lessThan(Duration.INFINITY)
 pre     getNextTimeAdvance().equals(getTimeOfNextEvent().subtract(getCurrentStateTime()))
 post   true            // no postcondition.
        Specified by:
        output in interface AtomicModelI
        Returns:
        the corresponding external events or null if none.
        See Also:
        AtomicModelI.output()

      • userDefinedInternalTransition

        public void userDefinedInternalTransition(Duration elapsedTime)
        Description copied from interface: ModelI
        do an internal transition; this method is user model-dependent hence must be implemented by the user for atomic models; the user implementation should not change any of the implementation related variables.

        Description

        The current simulation time when this method is called can be accessed by calling the method getCurrentStateTime.

        Contract

         pre     isInitialised()
 pre     getCurrentStateTime().equals(getTimeOfNextEvent())
 pre     elapsedTime != null && elapsedTime.lessThan(Duration.INFINITY)
 post   true            // no postcondition.
        Specified by:
        userDefinedInternalTransition in interface ModelI
        Overrides:
        userDefinedInternalTransition in class AtomicModel
        Parameters:
        elapsedTime - time since the last event.
        See Also:
        AtomicModel.userDefinedInternalTransition(fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.time.Duration)

      • userDefinedExternalTransition

        public void userDefinedExternalTransition(Duration elapsedTime)
        Description copied from interface: ModelI
        do an external transition using a previously stored external input event; this method is user-model-dependent hence must be implemented by the user for atomic models; the user implementation should not change any of the implementation related variables.

        Description

        The current simulation time when this method is called can be accessed by calling the method getCurrentStateTime.

        Contract

         pre     isInitialised()
 pre     elapsedTime != null
 pre     getNextTimeAdvance().greaterThanOrEqual(elapsedTime)
 post   true            // no postcondition.
        Specified by:
        userDefinedExternalTransition in interface ModelI
        Overrides:
        userDefinedExternalTransition in class AtomicModel
        Parameters:
        elapsedTime - simulation time since the last processed event.
        See Also:
        AtomicModel.userDefinedExternalTransition(fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.time.Duration)

        terminate the current simulation.

        Description
